title: Cesária Évora
summary: Cesária Évora GCIH (Portuguese pronunciation: [sɨˈzaɾiɐ ˈɛvuɾɐ]; 27 August 1941 – 17 December 2011), more commonly known as Cize,[1] was a Cape Verdean singer-songwriter.[2] She received a Grammy Award in 2004 for her album Voz d'Amor. Nicknamed the "Barefoot Diva" for performing without shoes,[3] she was known as the "Queen of Morna".[4]
